   "source": [
    "# Linear Advection\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "a1b57533",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:41.678105Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:41.677841Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.373603Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.372696Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "\n",
    "from landlab import HexModelGrid, RasterModelGrid, imshow_grid\n",
    "\n",
    "parameters = {}   # default for dune component is \"limiter\":\"default\", \"order\":0}\n",
    "if False:\n",
    "    from landlab.components import AdvectionSolverTVD as AdvectionSolver\n",
    "else:\n",
    "    from dune.femdg.landlab import DuneAdvectionSolver as AdvectionSolver\n",
    "    # parameters = {\"limiter\":\"default\",\"order\":1}\n",
    "    # parameters = {\"limiter\":None,\"order\":1}\n",
    "    # parameters = {\"limiter\":None,\"order\":0}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "7697014f",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Advection of a Gaussian \"bump\" in 2d\n",
    "\n",
    "We start by defining a function to make the initial bump, and a function to report the cumulative translation of the peak of the bump."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "b5aff2d4",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.375853Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.375533Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.379423Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.378682Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def make_gaussian_bump(grid, field, width, center=[0.5,0.5]):\n",
    "    midx = 0.5 * np.amax(grid.x_of_node) - 0.5 + center[0]\n",
    "    midy = 0.5 * np.amax(grid.y_of_node) - 0.5 + center[1]\n",
    "    dist_sq = (grid.x_of_node - midx) ** 2 + (grid.y_of_node - midy) ** 2\n",
    "    field[:] = np.exp(-0.5 * dist_sq / bump_width)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "e37dafc8",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.381270Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.381096Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.384999Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.384179Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def calc_translation_distance(grid, elev, x0, y0, u, dt=None, nt=None):\n",
    "    highest_node = np.argmax(elev)\n",
    "    distance = np.sqrt(\n",
    "        (grid.x_of_node[highest_node] - x0) ** 2\n",
    "        + (grid.y_of_node[highest_node] - y0) ** 2\n",
    "    )\n",
    "    print(\"Velocity magnitude is\", u)\n",
    "    if dt is not None:\n",
    "        print(\"Duration is\", dt * nt)\n",
    "        print(\"Predicted distance is\", u * dt * nt)\n",
    "    print(\"Modeled distance is\", distance)\n",
    "    print(\"Min/Max\",min(elev),\"/\",max(elev))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "9ff5287b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Raster grid with advection to the east\n",
    "\n",
    "Note that when we instantiate the component, we will leave its value of `advection_direction_is_steady` at the default of `False`. We do this because we are going to reuse the component several times with different advection directions, so we want it to recompute the upwind links."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "dbad3422",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.386593Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.386421Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.389540Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.388702Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Parameters\n",
    "nrows = 51\n",
    "ncols = 51\n",
    "ux = 1.0\n",
    "uy = 0.0\n",
    "c = 0.2\n",
    "nnodes = 100\n",
    "ntimesteps = 100\n",
    "bump_width = 0.01  # width of Gaussian bump"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "1defdcc5",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.391099Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.390929Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.412223Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.411503Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Setup\n",
    "dx = 1.0 / (nrows - 1)\n",
    "u = (ux * ux + uy * uy) ** 0.5\n",
    "dt = c * dx / u\n",
    "\n",
    "# create grid\n",
    "grid = RasterModelGrid((nrows, ncols), xy_spacing=dx)\n",
    "\n",
    "# create fields\n",
    "elev = grid.add_zeros(\"topographic__elevation\", at=\"node\")\n",
    "vel = grid.add_zeros(\"advection__velocity\", at=\"link\")\n",
    "\n",
    "# initialize fields\n",
    "make_gaussian_bump(grid, elev, bump_width,center=[0.25,0.5])\n",
    "maxnode = np.argmax(elev)\n",
    "x0 = grid.x_of_node[maxnode]\n",
    "y0 = grid.y_of_node[maxnode]\n",
    "vel[grid.horizontal_links] = ux\n",
    "vel[grid.vertical_links] = uy"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "4030c237",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Instantiate component"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "id": "96e67df5",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.414135Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:43.413853Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.334668Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.333647Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [

      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "adv = AdvectionSolver(grid, fields_to_advect=\"topographic__elevation\", **parameters)\n",
    "imshow_grid(adv.grid, elev)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "id": "12e5cf2b",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.336308Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.336127Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.629048Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:44.628073Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Velocity magnitude is 1.0\n",
      "Duration is 0.4\n",
      "Predicted distance is 0.4\n",
      "Modeled distance is 0.44000000000000006\n",
      "Min/Max -8.095315298646221e-11 / 0.9637820475563053\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/jpeg": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 320x240 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "for _ in range(ntimesteps):\n",
    "    adv.update(dt)\n",
    "imshow_grid(adv.grid, elev)\n",
    "calc_translation_distance(grid, elev, x0, y0, u, dt, ntimesteps)"
   ]
  },

    "### Raster grid with a non-uniform advection field\n",
    "\n",
    "This example tests the component with a non-uniform advection field. For this test, we will shear the Gaussian bump by having $x$-directed motion that accelerates in the $y$ direction."
   ]

    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Re-initialize and run again, this time with anti-x-directed motion\n",
    "ux_max = 1.0\n",
    "uy = 0.0\n",
    "u = ux_max\n",
    "\n",
    "make_gaussian_bump(grid, elev, bump_width)\n",
    "elev0 = elev.copy()\n",
    "vel[grid.horizontal_links] = (\n",

    ")\n",
    "vel[grid.vertical_links] = 0.0\n",

    "    adv.initial()\n",
    "except:\n",

   ]

   "source": [
    "### Case of divergent velocity\n",
    "\n",
    "Here the velocity field diverges around $x=1/2$, which produces a rift in the midst of our Gaussian bump: a bit like Iceland might be without the volcanoes ..."
   ]

    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Identify places with positive vs. negative x-wise velocity\n",
    "make_gaussian_bump(grid, elev, bump_width)\n",
    "elev0 = elev.copy()\n",
    "vel_is_neg = grid.x_of_node[grid.node_at_link_head] <= 0.5\n",
    "vel[:] = 0.5\n",
    "vel[vel_is_neg] = -0.5\n",
    "vel[grid.vertical_links] = 0.0\n",
    "try:\n",
    "    adv.initial()\n",
    "except:\n",
    "    pass"
   ]
  },

   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## A rotating cone"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 16,
   "id": "acb6c5a5",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-12-01T22:09:45.679719Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-12-01T22:09:45.679528Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-12-01T22:09:45.802039Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-12-01T22:09:45.801357Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/jpeg": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 320x240 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "def make_cone(grid, field, width, center, radius):\n",
    "    midx = 0.5 * np.amax(grid.x_of_node) - 0.5 + center[0]\n",
    "    midy = 0.5 * np.amax(grid.y_of_node) - 0.5 + center[1]\n",
    "    absDist = radius - ( abs(grid.x_of_node - midx) + abs(grid.y_of_node - midy) )\n",
    "    field[:] = absDist[:] / max(absDist)\n",
    "    field[absDist<0] = 0\n",
    "\n",
    "make_cone(grid, elev, bump_width, center=[0.25,0.5], radius=0.2)\n",
    "\n",
    "imshow_grid(adv.grid, elev)"
   ]
  },

   "source": [
    "elev0 = elev.copy()\n",
    "\n",
    "ux = 2 * np.pi\n",
    "uy = 2 * np.pi\n",
    "u = (ux * ux + uy * uy) ** 0.5\n",
    "dt = c * dx / u\n",
    "\n",
    "ntimesteps = int(1 / dt)\n",
    "\n",
    "vel[grid.horizontal_links] = - np.pi * (\n",
    "              grid.y_of_node[grid.node_at_link_tail[grid.horizontal_links]] +\n",
    "              grid.y_of_node[grid.node_at_link_head[grid.horizontal_links]] - 1\n",
    ")\n",
    "vel[grid.vertical_links] = np.pi * (\n",
    "              grid.x_of_node[grid.node_at_link_tail[grid.vertical_links]] +\n",
    "              grid.x_of_node[grid.node_at_link_head[grid.vertical_links]] - 1\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "try:\n",
    "    adv.initial()\n",
    "except:\n",
    "    pass\n",
    "\n",
    "for i in range(ntimesteps):\n",
    "    adv.update(dt)\n",
    "    if i%400 == 0:\n",
    "        plt.figure()\n",
    "        imshow_grid(adv.grid, elev)\n",
    "\n",
    "if dt*ntimesteps < 1-0.1*dt:\n",
    "    adv.update(1-dt*ntimesteps)\n",
    "plt.figure()\n",
    "imshow_grid(adv.grid, elev)"
   ]
